Name: Statue of Pediamenopet, Son of Menkhast
Description: In this statue, the official Pediamenopet is seated on a cube-shaped seat with a projecting base. His hands rest on his knees. His right palm is closed in a fist and placed horizontally, while the left is open and spread over his thigh. He is wearing a wig and a short kilt. Pediamenopet is shown with a rounded face and his gaze is turned upwards. The body is well modeled with broad shoulders and muscular arms and legs. The cube-shaped seat is inscribed with a hieroglyphic text.
